questions.question: In the modern periodic table, elements are arranged in order of increasing:
questions.explanation: The modern periodic table is organized by the number of protons (atomic number), which ensures that elements with similar properties fall into the same columns.

questions.question: What are the vertical columns of the periodic table called?
questions.explanation: Vertical columns are known as groups or families; elements within a group typically share similar chemical properties and the same number of valence electrons.

questions.question: The horizontal rows of the periodic table are called:
questions.explanation: There are 7 periods in the modern periodic table, each representing a new principal energy level being filled with electrons.

questions.question: Elements in the same group have the same number of __________ , which explains their similar chemical behavior.
questions.explanation: Because they have the same number of electrons in their outermost shell, elements in a group react in very similar ways.

questions.question: What do all elements in Period 3 have in common?
options: Their valence electrons are in the third principal energy level.
They all have three valence electrons.
They all have the same atomic mass.
They are all gases at room temperature.
questions.explanation: The period number indicates the highest occupied principal energy level ($n$) for the atoms of those elements.

questions.question: Which block of the periodic table contains the transition metals?
questions.explanation: The transition metals correspond to the filling of the $d$ sublevel orbitals.

questions.question: The elements in Groups 1, 2, and 13 through 18 are collectively known as the:
questions.explanation: These are also called Main Group elements because they display a wide range of physical and chemical properties that vary predictably.

questions.question: How many groups and periods are there in the standard modern periodic table?
questions.explanation: The table consists of 18 vertical columns (Groups) and 7 horizontal rows (Periods).

questions.question: To which block do the Lanthanides and Actinides belong?
questions.explanation: These elements, often shown at the bottom of the table, represent the filling of the $f$ sublevel orbitals.

questions.question: An element is located in Group 18 of the periodic table. This indicates that it:
options: Has a full outer energy level.
Is a metal that conducts electricity well.
questions.explanation: Group 18 elements are the Noble Gases, characterized by a full valence shell, which makes them very stable and unreactive.
